channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Dining in, shopping, swimming and more: How safe are these activities as Singapore enters phase 2?
item.description:
June 17, 2020 9:18 AM

As Singapore moves into the second phase of the easing of restrictions, Clara Chong talks to experts to ﬁnd out how to mitigate the risks of some activities.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on June 17
NUS student sues driver, ex-cabby for negligence
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

A former cabby and a car driver involved in an accident two years ago have been sued for negligence by one of the four taxi passengers.

item.title: Phase 2 reopening: How safe an activity is depends on various factors, say experts
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

With phase two of reopening due to start in two days, a range of restrictions will be eased, and the new default approach is for most activities to be allowed to resume.

item.title: Man charged with misappropriating over $5 million
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

A former pawnshop director accused of misappropriating more than $5 million from his then-workplace faced 23 charges yesterday for offences including those related to criminal breach of trust and falsification of accounts.

item.title: Phase 2 reopening: Beware taking one step forward, two steps back
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Resuming activities will be a breath of fresh air for some, and a lifeline for others. But the danger is far from over.

item.title: DJ Tenashar handed additional charges
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

DJ Tenashar, who faces drug-related charges, is now accused of other offences including stealing a blue hospital gown at Ng Teng Fong General Hospital and using a stolen access pass to trespass into areas meant only for its staff.

item.title: Seats, tables at hawker centres to be marked for different sized groups
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Seating arrangements at hawker centres will be changed to accommodate the new safe distancing measures for dining in during phase two, the National Environment Agency (NEA) said yesterday.

item.title: Grab cuts headcount by 5% amid Covid-19 economic fallout
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Technology company Grab is cutting about 360 jobs, or around 5 per cent of its headcount, amid the growing economic fallout from the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: New daily infections down to 151 - lowest since April 8
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of new daily coronavirus patients here and the average number of new cases in the community each day have continued to fall, ahead of the further reopening of Singapore's economy from Friday.

item.title: From eateries to tuition centres: Businesses in Singapore gearing up for phase 2 reopening
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Businesses are putting in place safety measures and making adjustments as they get ready to welcome customers come Friday (June 19).

item.title: 52 fines issued to employers for flouting safe management measures
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of 52 composition fines of $1,000 each have been issued to employers for flouting safe management measures, as the Manpower Ministry (MOM) continues to stress the importance of such practices.

item.title: Weekly number of dengue cases at historical high
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of weekly dengue infections has soared past the 1,000 mark for the first time in Singapore's history. The 1,158 cases last week is a huge 33 per cent increase over the 870 people infected in the previous week.

item.title: Tuition and enrichment centres to cut class sizes and tweak lesson schedules for phase 2 reopening
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Tuition and other private enrichment centres will implement additional safety measures, including reducing class sizes and rescheduling some lessons, before they are allowed to resume operating from Friday as Singapore moves to phase two of reopening.

item.title: Household electricity usage up 22% in May
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Household electricity consumption jumped almost a quarter last month compared with February, according to figures from the Energy Market Authority (EMA) and national grid power operator SP Group.

item.title: Stranded overseas, foreigners await return
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

When Ms Isha Chaudhari travelled out of Singapore in February, she did not think that she would not see her husband again for more than four months.

item.title: Another two men charged with Covid-19 offences
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Another two men have been charged over their alleged involvement in an incident last month in which people were seen gathering in the Robertson Quay area.

item.title: Retail outlets must adhere to strict safety measures
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Retail establishments, which are being allowed to open physical stores on Friday, will have to adhere to strict safety measures including occupancy limits, frequent cleaning of common areas, and implementation of the Government's visitor check-in system SafeEntry.

item.title: Building design standards may be revised, says BCA
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

Building design rules could change, as the Building and Construction Authority (BCA) begins discussions with industry experts on whether rules on air-conditioning and mechanical ventilation in buildings need to be revised in the light of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Changi T5 construction pushed back by two years
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

With a cloud hanging over the future of aviation, Singapore has halted construction of the upcoming mega Changi Airport Terminal 5 for at least two years, and will review its scale and design.

item.title: All workers in dorms must activate contact tracing app by Friday
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

All workers staying in dormitories will have to download and activate the national contact tracing app TraceTogether by Friday, the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) said yesterday.

item.title: President gives nod for $33b in relief measures
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

President Halimah Yacob yesterday gave her assent to a second Supplementary Supply Bill, which will fund Covid-19 support measures totalling $33 billion.

item.title: Sing We Are Singapore and lend a voice to NDP's virtual choir
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

While this year's National Day Parade (NDP) theme song is yet to be announced, one familiar favourite will feature in the celebrations come Aug 9.

item.title: President Halimah gives assent to additional $33b in support packages
item.description:
June 17, 2020 5:00 AM

President Halimah Yacob has given the go-ahead to fund Covid-19 support packages totalling $33 billion, which could draw up to an additional $31 billion from Singapore's past reserves.

item.title: Early tech push eases Covid-19 impact
item.description:
June 17, 2020 4:00 AM

Digital services such as Moments of Life and the GoBusiness portal are helping the community adapt to a new way of life
